uhm I think that there is a limit though, when you get to rework Nunu, Urgot, Teemo, Malphite and Evelynn, the remaining ones aren't all that bad looking O.o

Nunu got a small rework on his passive, q, r, and base stats; and although it looks small, it had a huge impact on both my gameplay and his win rate. Like his q was basically worthless before, paired with his w which is fairly situational, and an ult that had a high fail rate, he really only had one working ability. The old q was giving him different buffs for eating different jungle monsters, and if the one you needed to match your play style was already dead you would be put behind, if laning you would fall behind trying to go to the right camp to get the buff you needed, it was just not worth it. Now it doesnt matter which you get it from, and the stacks last longer. Also having it be one stat increase rather than 5 small ones, gives a clearer build path. The increase in base AD and AD scaling made w a little less situational, and having the way the slow in his ult works made it so that if you used it when standing right next to someone they could no longer escape, and you wouldnt have to interupt early for less damage.

Can someone at riot tell me why runes are so expensive? How does making them so expensive make the game fair? Why do I have to decide between playing different champions and having an in game advantage? Why have 0 rioters ever responded to this?

We're planning to do some work on runes sometime next year - there are a number of things about them we think we could improve. It's also a system with a lot of history to it, much of which is outside of my area of expertise and that of most Rioters. That's why it's not a topic that gets responded to much.
Couldn't you just give a band-aid fix like reducing the prices, or maybe offering more sales?

They could, but Riot seems to have something against band-aid fixes. For example, they said they would give a few to Aatrox in the pre-season, but now they've pushed it off to next year. I can understand they might not want to spend too much time balancing temporary fixes, but still...

Champions I understand, but these are runes. There are no unintended side effects for making runes, or at least the pages, cheaper. They could also provide more sales. One during the preseason, one during the midseason, and one near the end of the season.
There _are_ side effects. Inherent side effects because Runes are a part of the F2P business model and this sort of thing extends beyond just the gameplay.

Riot earns a good 90% of their revenue from champion and skin sales. Runes aren't even buyable, and you can only buy max 20 rune pages (with a 7 page bundle that cuts the cost of the pages down by like 30-40% as well?). 

Making them cheaper won't really affect their business model at all - because making runes IP purchasable only already affected the entire F2P model of their rune system. They've already made it clear with that change that "Runes are not meant to be a buy-to-excel" aspect of the game. In fact that was exactly what they said when they made that change, like 5 seasons ago now.

And you know the percentages because you are looking at some Riot official earnings breakdown kind of thing? Or are you making numbers up and passing them off as fact because it sounds correct to you?
Runes are bought using the numerical incentivization of play portion of the game known as IP, it is as such inherently linked to the business model of Freemium games like this.  Champions are bought with RP and IP.  Rune Pages, which you even mention yourself, are bought with RP and IP.   This does effect the game as a business.

I would imagine another reason why they still make runes harder to obtain than most people would want them to be might be because if runes were easy to obtain then that is just another lower barrier to creating infinite smurfs.   Could allow those toxic players to care much much less about getting permabanned if it gets even easier to make/buy new accounts lol. At higher rank it might not matter as much in terms of having infinite smurfs because they are making it harder to maintain alot of smurfs. 

I also think another reason why they dont allow RP purchases of runes (even tho smurfs would probably buy them to make life so much easier). Is so that if people do buy accounts that were like SUPER pushed from (1-30) with like double XP boost, then it wont have good runes or any at all lol. So it forces the purchased account owner to atleast grind IP for playable runes.

I totally get the decision to avoid band aids. With a few exceptions temporary fixes tend to have quality issues, persist way longer than originally intended, create unintended side effects and is overall more costly than a proper rework. 

The one aspect of riot that stands out to me is their level of quality is way above other games companies. Oh and their community engagement is second to none. :)
Thanks

It's business strategy, they don't respond because they cannot, they are bound by a contract and could lose their job. Want a short answer? Spend IP on runes/pages no IP for champs, some want new champ so they buy it with RP which = $$
